6.4: if I have dealt evil to my ally—I who rescued my foe without reward—
6.5: then let the enemy pursue and overtake me; let him trample my life to the ground, and lay my body in the dust. Selah.

16.7: Protect me as the apple of your eye, under the shadow of your wings, cover me up.

19.0: 1. For the conductor, a song of David.
19.1: 2. The Lord will answer you on a day of distress; the name of the God of Jacob will fortify you.
19.2: 3. He will send your aid from His sanctuary, and support you from Zion.
19.3: 4. He will remember all your meal offerings and He will accept your fat burnt offerings forever.
19.4: 5. He will give you as your heart [desires], and all your plans He will fulfill.
19.5: 6. We will rejoice in your salvation, and assemble in the name of our God; the Lord will fulfill all your requests.
19.6: 7. Now I know that the Lord saved His anointed; He answered him from His holy heavens; with the mighty acts of salvation from His right hand.
19.7: 8. These trust in chariots and these in horses, but we with the mentioning of the name of the Lord our God.
19.8: 9. They kneel and fall, but we rise and gain strength.
19.9: 10. O Lord, save [us]; the King will answer us on the day we call.

23.0: This is a song, written by David. The Land and everything within it is God’s; and the inhabited land (cities) and all who dwell within it [are God’s].
23.1: Because He is the one Who founded [the Land] on the seas; [and He is the one Who] set it up on the rivers.
23.2: Who will ascend upon the mountain of God? And Who will arise in His holy [or: distinguished] place?
23.3: The one who has clean hands, a pure heart; who has not raised My soul to falsehood and not sworn to deceive.
23.4: He [the man] will carry blessing from God and [carry] tzedakah from the Lord of his salvation.
23.5: This is the generation [or: group] who seek Him; the [ones] who seek your face [are] Yaakov- Selah.
23.6: Raise up, gates, your heads and become eternal portals; and the Honored King will come!
23.7: Who is this Honored King? [He is] God, mighty and valiant;[He is] God, valiant in war!
23.8: Raise up, gates, your heads! Become eternal portals! And the Honored King will come!
23.9: [But] Who is this, this Honored King? [The] God of Legions; this is the Honored King! Selah.

47.0: A song [written by] the sons of Korach
47.1: God is great and immensely praised; in the city of our Lord, His distinguished mountain.
47.2: ‘[Because of] its beautiful condition, the entire land celebrates; the mountain of Zion is the innermost chambers of the North - the dwelling of a great King.
47.3: The Lord is in its [the city’s] castles; [He is] known as a protector.
47.4: Because, when all the kings converged together, they also passed [fled] together,
47.5: They saw and were immediately startled; they were terrified and fled, panic stricken,
47.6: A trembling seized them there; like a woman’s birth pains,
47.7: With an Eastern wind You broke the ships of Tarshish.
47.8: Just like we heard, so too, we saw, In the city of the God of Legions, in the City of our Lord; [May] the Lord [will] sustain her [Yerushalayim] for ever! Selah.
47.9: ‘[Previously] we [only] imagined Your kindness, God, within Your temple.
47.10: Just like Your name, so too Your praise [or emanations] reach to the ends of the earth; Righteousness fills Your right hand.
47.11: Har Tzion will rejoice; the Daughters of Yehudah will celebrate, because of Your judgments.
47.12: Rally around Tzion and encircle it; count its towers,
47.13: Mark with your hearts the wall; elevate its palaces.
47.14: This is the God, our God, for eternity; He will direct us ‘Al-Mut’.

69.0: For the conductor (David) to be mentioned,

80.0: To the victor/conductor over the ‘wine pressing’ – by Asaf.
80.1: Sing out in celebration to the Lord Who is our strength; call out to the Lord of Yaakov.
80.2: Rise up in song, play the drum, the pleasant harp and the Navel!
80.3: Blow, on Rosh Chodesh, a shofar; on the covered [time] for your holiday.
80.4: Because it is a law for Yisrael and a judgment for the Lord of Yaakov.
80.5: He placed it as a testimonial in [for] Yosef when He went forth over Egypt…
80.6: I have removed his shoulders from the burden; his hands should pass on [from] the pot.
80.7: You called out in times of suffering and I released you.… I will answer you hidden behind thunder; I will test you at the Waters of Dispute. Selah.
80.8: Listen my nation and I will rebuke you; Yisrael, if you listen to Me.
80.9: There should not be any alien gods within you; and do not bow down to any foreign gods.
80.10: I am the God your Lord Who brought you up from Egypt; open your mouth wide and I will fill it.
80.11: And My nation did not listen to My voice, and Yisrael did not heed Me
80.12: I freed them to their heart’s stubbornness, to follow their own choices.
80.13: If only My nation would listen to Me and Yisrael would walk in My ways,
80.14: Immediately I would humble their subjugators; and on their enemies I would return My hand.
80.15: The enemies of God will feign [praise] to Him and their time will be eternal.
80.16: And He will feed it from the fat of the wheat’s, and from the rock, I will satisfy you.

81.0: A psalm [written by] Asaf. The Lord stands in the Divine assembly; in its midst, the Lord will judge.
81.1: How long will you judge corruptly? And [how long will] you favor the evil ones? Selah.
81.2: Judge the lowly and the orphan; give justice to the dependent and the poor!
81.3: Rescue the lowly and the defenseless; save them from the hands of the evil ones!
81.4: They [the judges] have never known and will never understand- they will [always] walk in darkness. The foundations of the land will totter.
81.5: I said: you were Elohim; and [that] all of you [were] sons of the Most High.
81.6: Therefore: like Man you will die; and like one of the officers you will fall.
81.7: Stand up, Lord, and judge the land. Because You will inherit amongst the nations.

91.0: A psalm and song to Shabbat.
91.1: It is good to give thanks to God; [it is good] to sing out to Your lofty name.
91.2: To declare in the morning of Your loving kindness; [to tell] of Your faithfulness in the nights.
91.3: [Playing] on the strings of the ten-stringed instrument, and on the strings of the lyre; with voice accompanied by the harp.
91.4: Because God you have made me happy in [with] Your work, with Your handiwork I will sing out!
91.5: How great are your works, God; Your thoughts are very deep.
91.6: [However,] an ignoramus will not know and a fool will not understand this.
91.7: When the evil ones sprout like weeds and the evil doers shoot, it is to their eternal destruction.
91.8: And [or: because] You are on high, forever, God.
91.9: Because behold Your enemies, God, behold Your enemies will be lost; the evil doers will disintegrate.
91.10: When You raise up my horn like a Re’em, I am drenched in freshening oil.
91.11: My eye has seen concerning my enemies; concerning those evil ones that stand up against me, my ears will hear.
91.12: A Tzadik blooms like a Date Palm; like a Cedar of Lebanon he flourishes.
91.13: planted in the house of God; in our Lord’s courtyards they will be given to blossom.
91.14: They will continue to produce in their old age; fresh and full of sap they will be.
91.15: To say that God is upright; [He is] my Rock, without blemish.

92.0: God has been appointed King, clothed in grandeur, God is clothed, belted with might; therefore, the inhabited world is established and will not stumble.
92.1: Your throne is right [established] from before; You have always been.
92.2: [1] The rivers have risen up, God, [2] the rivers have raised their voices; [3] they will lift up their fall.
92.3: Above the roaring of the many waters, [above] the might of the ocean’s breakers: mighty in the heavens is God.
92.4: Your testimonies are very true, [the label] ‘distinguished’ befits Your house: God for the length of days.

93.0: God of retribution, Lord; God of retribution show Himself.
93.1: Arise, Judge of the land; deservedly reciprocate on the arrogant.
93.2: How long, the evil ones, God? How long will the evil ones rejoice?
93.3: They express and speak [words of] arrogance; all the evil doers speak their minds.
93.4: Your nation, God, they crush; Your inheritance they oppress.
93.5: They kill the widow and the proselyte; they murder the orphans.
93.6: And they say: God will not see; the Lord of Yaakov will not understand.
93.7: Understand you unrefined among the nation; fools, when you will become intelligent?
93.8: The One Who plants ears, does he not hear? If He creates eyes, does He not see?
93.9: The discipliner of the nations, does He not rebuke? The One Who teaches humankind knowledge?
93.10: God knows the thoughts of humankind; that they are nothing.
93.11: Advanced is the man who You, God, disciplines/punishes; [and advanced is the man] who You teach from Your Torah.
93.12: To give him quiet from the evil days; while/until He digs the grave for the evil one.
93.13: Because God will never forsake His nation; His inheritance He will never ignore.
93.14: Because until righteousness [is attained] judgment will return; and after it all the upright.
93.15: Who will rise up for me against the evil ones? Who will stand up for me against the evil doers?
93.16: If it hadn’t been for God’s help, my soul would have been quickly embedded in silence.
93.17: If I said my feet have stumbled; the loving-kindness of God will steady me.
93.18: With the multitude of thoughts inside of me, Your comforts sooth my soul.
93.19: Could a throne of evil befriend You [that] forms evil into law?
93.20: Can they [the evil] amass against the soul of the righteous? [Can] innocent blood be convicted?
93.21: God became a fortress for me; and my Lord [became] as a rock of refuge.
93.22: And God returned upon them their own might and in their evil He stunned them.

95.0: Canten al Eterno una canción nueva, canten al Señor, todo el mundo.
95.1: Canten al Eterno, bendigan su nombre, proclamen su victoria día a día.
95.2: Cuenten de su gloria entre las naciones, sus actos, entre todas las gentes.
95.3: Porque el Eterno es grande y aclamado, lo asombran todos los seres divinos.
95.4: Porque todos los dioses de las gentes son ídolos pero el Eterno hizo el cielo.
95.5: Gloria y majestad están delante de Él; fuerza y esplendor están en su templo.

112.0: Halleluyah!  Praise, servants of the LORD; praise the name of the LORD.
112.1: Let the name of the LORD be blessed now and forever.

129.4: I and my soul hope for the LORD, and I await His word.

135.0: Praise Adonai for it is good, for God's love is eternal.
135.1: Praise the God of gods, for God's love is eternal.
135.2: Praise the Lord of lords, for God's love is eternal.
135.6: Who made the great lights, for God's love is eternal.
135.11: With a mighty hand and outstretched arm, for God's love is eternal.
135.25: Praise the heavenly God, for God's love is eternal.

144.15: You open your hand, and satisfy for all the living desire.
